class_notes: This is an online course. Full participation in synchronous sessions is required (meeting times listed are local to Atlanta), and students should plan to spend at least 15-20 hours/week on the course. Students should begin checking the Canvas course site regularly one week prior to the official start of the term.
course_description: Economics of money, credit, and banking with emphasis on factors influencing the quantity of money and effects on employment, output, and prices. Economic analysis of financial markets, financial institutions, monetary policy, and inflation.
prerequisites: (ECON 201 or ECON_OX 201) and (ECON 212 or ECON_OX  212) or equivalent transfer credit as a prerequisite.
